identificationModule.briefTitle: Longitudinal Endpoint Assessment of Disease Burden in HD
identificationModule.officialTitle: Longitudinal Endpoint Assessment of Disease Burden in HD

collaborators.name: University of Rochester Center for Health + Technology

descriptionModule.briefSummary: LEAD-HD is intended to collect and analyze self-reported health information from individuals with Huntington Disease (HD) or prodromal HD participating in a 24-month longitudinal natural history study using remote technologies.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The LEAD-HD study will be offered via HSG's online observational research platform called myHDstoryÂ®. This direct to patient study will collect and analyze self-reported health information from individuals with Huntington Disease (HD) or prodromal HD in a 24-month longitudinal natural history study that participants complete at any time and with their own electronic device.

primaryOutcomes.description: Obtain PRO natural history data in HD using the HD-HI and HD-PROP.
Identify demographic characteristics that are associated with faster or slower disease progression.
Assess the feasibility of conducting long-term longitudinal studies in HD using a direct-to-patient platform.

eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Must self-report they have been diagnosed with HD by a doctor or have undergone genetic testing, been found to carry the expanded allele responsible for HD and have no clinical diagnosis (prodromal HD) (HD-ISS Stage 2 or 3).

overallOfficials.name: Jamison Seabury
overallOfficials.affiliation: University of Rochester Center for Health + Technology

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: The accrued data will help create a patient-reported natural history of HD, clinically meaningful outcomes for clinical trials, a resource to enable respondents to participate in future research, and a shared longitudinal database for researchers to access and analyze de-identified data and publish findings.

browseBranches.name: Diseases and Abnormalities at or Before Birth
